intro: Epipactis greuteri subsp. preinensis, commonly known as the Prein’s helleborine, is a terrestrial orchid native to Central Europe. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and a single, showy, greenish-yellow flower with a distinctive, spurred lip. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It produces a single, erect stem bearing a single flower, which is pollinated by specific insects. This orchid is part of the Orchidaceae family and is known for its specialized adaptations to its ecological niche.
